insights.summary: NVIDIA delivered strong Q3 results driven by data center and AI compute platforms. Data Center revenue grew 66% year-over-year, with Blackwell architecture becoming the leading platform across customer categories. Regulatory challenges persist but do not significantly impede growth momentum.
keyQuotes: Blackwell Ultra is now our leading architecture across all customer categories
We are increasing our U.S.-based manufacturing and investing in specialized equipment
The recent rise in high-quality open-source foundation models is making advanced AI capabilities broadly accessible

insights.marketShareMention: We recognized Blackwell revenue across 25 all customer categories, led by large cloud service providers
regulatoryHeadwinds: Export controls on AI chips to China
Potential new AI export regulations
insights.summary: NVIDIA delivered exceptional Q2 results driven by accelerated computing and AI platforms, with Data Center revenue growing 56% year-over-year. The company continues to expand its Blackwell architecture and navigate complex geopolitical export regulations.
keyQuotes: We continue to ramp our Blackwell architecture, which grew 17% sequentially, including our newest architecture, Blackwell Ultra.
We plan to increase our U.S.-based manufacturing and invest in specialized equipment and processes to support domestic production.

insights.marketShareMention: Blackwell architecture ramp expanding to all customer categories
regulatoryHeadwinds: US export controls on H20 products to China
Potential new AI export regulations
insights.summary: NVIDIA reported strong Data Center and AI revenue growth of 69% YoY, driven by Blackwell architecture, but faced significant challenges from US export controls on H20 products to China, resulting in a $4.5 billion inventory charge. Future revenue and market access in China remain uncertain.
keyQuotes: We are still evaluating our limited options to supply Data Center compute products compliant with the USG's export control rules.
The H20 export licensing requirements have impacted our current revenue and will also negatively affect our future revenue.

partnerships: Cloud Service Providers for NVIDIA DGX Cloud

insights.summary: NVIDIA delivered exceptional financial performance in fiscal 2025, driven by strong demand for AI and accelerated computing platforms. Data Center revenue grew 162%, powered by Hopper and new Blackwell architectures. The company continues to lead in AI technology innovation.
keyQuotes: Advancements in accelerated computing and generative AI models have driven increased demand for our Data Center systems
We continue to increase our supply and capacity purchases to support demand projections

insights.marketShareMention: Strong demand for Hopper architecture and H200 offering

insights.summary: NVIDIA delivered exceptional Q3 performance driven by strong AI and Data Center demand, with revenue up 94% YoY to $35.1B. Data Center revenue grew 112% YoY, representing approximately 88% of total revenue, fueled by generative AI and large language model applications.
keyQuotes: Advancements in accelerated computing and generative AI models, along with the growth in model complexity and scale, have driven increased demand for our Data Center systems
We have introduced a new architecture cadence of our Data Center solutions where we seek to complete a new computing architecture each year

insights.marketShareMention: Strong Hopper GPU and emerging Blackwell architecture market position

insights.summary: NVIDIA delivered exceptional Q2 performance driven by strong AI and data center demand, with revenue growing 122% year-over-year. The company is positioning itself at the forefront of AI computing with its Hopper and upcoming Blackwell architectures, despite geopolitical challenges.
keyQuotes: Demand estimates for our new products, applications, and services can be incorrect and create volatility in our revenue or supply levels.
We expect to ship several billion dollars in Blackwell revenue in the fourth quarter of fiscal year 2025.

insights.summary: NVIDIA delivered exceptional Q1 results driven by massive AI-driven data center demand, with revenue up 262% year-over-year and net income up 628%. The company's Hopper GPU platform and AI infrastructure solutions continue to see tremendous market traction across cloud, enterprise, and consumer internet segments.
keyQuotes: We believe the initial demand for Blackwell is well ahead of the projected supply for this fiscal year
Large cloud providers continued to drive strong growth as they deploy and ramp NVIDIA AI infrastructure at scale

insights.summary: NVIDIA delivered exceptional financial performance in fiscal year 2024, with revenue growing 126% to $60.9B and net income surging 581% to $29.8B, driven primarily by strong AI and Data Center demand.
keyQuotes: Demand for our data center systems and products surged in fiscal year 2024
We launched AI inference platforms that combine our full-stack inference software with NVIDIA processors optimized for generative AI

insights.summary: NVIDIA delivered exceptional Q3 performance, driven by explosive AI demand and Data Center growth. Revenue surged 206% YoY to $18.12B, with Data Center revenue up 279%, reflecting massive adoption of AI computing platforms.
keyQuotes: Demand for our data center systems and products has surged over the last three quarters and our demand visibility extends into next year.
Strong sales of the NVIDIA HGX platform were driven by global demand for the training and inferencing of large language models, recommendation engines, and generative AI applications.

insights.summary: NVIDIA delivered exceptional Q2 results, driven by surging demand for AI and data center computing platforms. Revenue and net income more than doubled year-over-year, with generative AI and large language models fueling unprecedented growth in the compute and networking segment.
keyQuotes: Demand for our data center systems and products has surged over the last two quarters and our demand visibility extends into next year
Strong demand for the NVIDIA HGX platform based on our Hopper and Ampere GPU architectures was primarily driven by the development of large language models and generative AI

insights.summary: NVIDIA delivered strong Q1 results driven by generative AI demand, particularly in Data Center segment. Despite macroeconomic challenges, the company showed resilience with 14% year-over-year growth in Compute & Networking revenue and continued investment in AI technologies.
keyQuotes: Growing demand for generative AI and large language models using GPUs based on our NVIDIA Hopper and Ampere architectures
We launched NVIDIA AI Foundations to help businesses create and operate custom large language models and generative AI models
